Class SFDCAccessController

public class SFDCAccessController

This class provides access control functionality to enforce CRUD/FLS and sharing in the force.com platform.

Nested Class Summary
 class SFDCAccessController.AccessControlDmlException
           
 
Enum Summary

          OperationMode - this enum defines the DB operations mode to be used.
SFDCAccessController.SharingMode
          SharingMode - this enum defines the sharing mode to be used.

Constructor Detail

SFDCAccessController

public SFDCAccessController()
Default constructor - will set sharing mode to SharingMode.WITH, operation mode to OperationMode.ALL_OR_NONE, and array operation mode to OperationMode.ALL_OR_NONE.

SFDCAccessController

public SFDCAccessController(SFDCAccessController.SharingMode smode,
                            SFDCAccessController.OperationMode omode)
This constructor allows you to set the sharing mode and operation mode while using default for array operation mode.

                            SFDCAccessController.OperationMode omode,
                            SFDCAccessController.OperationMode oarrmode)
This constructor allows you to set the sharing mode, operation mode, and array operation mode.

Method Detail

setSharingMode

public void setSharingMode(SFDCAccessController.SharingMode smode)
Set the sharing mode to use when calling this modules methods.

Example:
 try {
     ESAPI.accessController().setSharingMode(SFDCAccessController.SharingMode.WITH);
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

public void setOperationMode(SFDCAccessController.OperationMode omode)
Set the operation mode to use when calling this modules methods.

Example:
 try {
     ESAPI.accessController().setOperationMode(SFDCAccessController.OperationMode.ALL_OR_NONE);
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

Set the array operation mode to use when calling this modules methods.

Example:
 try {
     ESAPI.accessController().setArrayOperationMode(SFDCAccessController.OperationMode.ALL_OR_NONE);
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

insertAsUser

public void insertAsUser(SObject someObj,
                         List<String> fieldsToSet)
Insert the object with the context of the current user session.
Depending on the operation mode do the following:
BEST_EFFORT - just set the fields that both the user can set and that were specified in the fieldsToSet.
ALL_OR_NONE - if any of the fieldsToSet can't be created by the user, throw an exception.
In addition throw an exception if the user does not have the CREATE permission on the object.

Example:
 try {
     Contact c = new Contact();
     c.LastName = 'Doe';
     ESAPI.accessController().insertAsUser(c, new List{'LastName'});
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

insertAsUser

public Database.SaveResult[] insertAsUser(sObject[] someObjs,
                                       List<String> fieldsToSet)
Insert the objects with the context of the current user session.
Depending on the operation mode and array operation mode do:
operation mode: BEST_EFFORT - just set the fields that both the user can set and that were specified in the fieldsToSet.
ALL_OR_NONE - if any of the fieldsToSet can't be created by the user, throw an exception.
array operation mode: BEST_EFFORT - even if some objects are failing to insert, continue to insert the rest.
ALL_OR_NONE - if some objects are failing to insert, don't insert any.
In addition throw an exception if the user does not have the CREATE permission on the object.

Note: You must provide this function an array of sObject of concrete type in order to use this function.

Example:
 try {
     Contact c1 = new Contact();
     c1.LastName = 'ESAPI TestArray1 Spu8UY&thuCrUzAPa2ASTaC7rA$Ra3'; // We add this long random to make sure we will not conflict with any real last name
     Contact c2 = new Contact();
     c2.LastName = 'ESAPI TestArray2 Spu8UY&thuCrUzAPa2ASTaC7rA$Ra3'; // We add this long random to make sure we will not conflict with any real last name
     Contact [] arr = new Contact[]{c1, c2};
     Database.SaveResult[] res = ESAPI.accessController().insertAsUser(new Map(arr), new List{'LastName'});
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

Returns:
A list of Database.SaveResult objects. Use these objects to identify which objects were successfully inserted.

updateAsUser

public void updateAsUser(SObject someObj,
                         List<String> fieldsToUpdate)
Update the object with the context of the current user session.
Depending on the operation mode do the following:
BEST_EFFORT - just set the fields that both the user can update and that were specified in the fieldsToUpdate.
ALL_OR_NONE - if any of the fieldsToUpdate can't be updated by the user, throw an exception.
In addition throw an exception if the user does not have the UPDATE permission on the object.

Example:
 try {
     Contact c = (Contact)stdController.getRecord();
     c.LastName = 'Doe2';
     ESAPI.accessController().updateAsUser(c, new List{'LastName'});
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

updateAsUser

public Database.SaveResult[] updateAsUser(Map<ID, sObject> objMap,
                                       List<String> fieldsToUpdate)
Update the objects with the context of the current user session.
Depending on the operation mode and array operation mode do:
operation mode: BEST_EFFORT - just set the fields that both the user can update and that were specified in the fieldsToUpdate.
ALL_OR_NONE - if any of the fieldsToUpdate can't be updated by the user, throw an exception.
array operation mode: BEST_EFFORT - even if some objects are failing to update, continue to update the rest.
ALL_OR_NONE - if some objects are failing to update, don't update any.
In addition throw an exception if the user does not have the UPDATE permission on the object.

Note: You must provide this function a map of sObject of concrete type in order to use this function. We chose a map and not an array to increase performance. We couldn't internally convert from an array into a map because of Apex restrictions on maps with generic sObject type values.

Example:
 try {
     Contact [] arr = [select LastName,id from Contact];
     Database.SaveResult[] res = ESAPI.accessController().updateAsUser(new Map(arr), new List{'LastName'});
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

Returns:
A list of Database.SaveResult objects. Use these objects to identify which objects were successfully updated.

deleteAsUser

public void deleteAsUser(SObject someObj)
Delete the object with the context of the current user session. Throw exception if user can't delete this object.

Example:
 try {
     Contact c = (Contact)stdController.getRecord();
     ESAPI.accessController().deleteAsUser(c);
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

deleteAsUser

public Database.DeleteResult[] deleteAsUser(sObject[] someObjs)
Delete the objects with the context of the current user session.
Depending on the array operation mode do:
array operation mode: BEST_EFFORT - even if some objects are failing to delete, continue to delete the rest.
ALL_OR_NONE - if some objects are failing to delete, don't delete any.
In addition throw an exception if the user does not have the DELETE permission on the object.

Note: You must provide this function an array of sObject of concrete type in order to use this function.

Example:
 try {
     Contact [] arr = [select LastName,id from Contact];
     Database.DeleteResult[] res = ESAPI.accessController().deleteAsUser(arr);
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

Returns:
A list of Database.DeleteResult objects. Use these objects to identify which objects were successfully deleted.

Return a list of sobject fields that are viewable by the current user session.

Example:
 try {
     Contact c = (Contact)stdController.getRecord();
     String[] viewableFields = ESAPI.accessController().getViewableFields(c);
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

public List<Schema.SObjectField> getUpdateableFields(SObject someObj)
Return a list of sobject fields that are updateable by the current user session.

Example:
 try {
     Contact c = (Contact)stdController.getRecord();
     String[] updateableFields = ESAPI.accessController().getUpdateableFields(c);
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }

getCreatableFields

public List<Schema.SObjectField> getCreatableFields(SObject someObj)
Returns a list of sobject fields that are createable by the current user session.

Example:
 try {
     Contact c = (Contact)stdController.getRecord();
     String[] createableFields = ESAPI.accessController().getCreatableFields(c);
 } catch (SFDCAccessControlException e) {
     // error handling
 }
